Experiment_description: The experiments conducted explore various methods for glyph clustering and sequence classification using the SPR_BENCH dataset. Methods include baseline Bi-GRU classification, embedding-based linear classification, and novel glyph clustering with k-means. The aim is to evaluate and improve classification performance through different approaches.
Significance: These experiments are significant as they offer insights into effective glyph classification methods, highlighting the potential of glyph clustering to enhance model performance beyond traditional techniques. The findings contribute to the development of robust models capable of achieving state-of-the-art accuracy in sequence classification tasks.
Description: The experiments involved training models on the SPR_BENCH dataset, evaluating them with metrics such as accuracy, PCWA, CWA, and SWA. Baseline methods used Bi-GRU classifiers, while advanced methods employed glyph clustering and k-means on token embeddings. Each experiment was GPU-accelerated and systematically stored results for comparison.
